title: Altman calls for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body in New Delhi, warning of the approaching era of super artificial intelligence.
summary: According to Outlook India, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman delivered a keynote speech at the "AI Impact Summit 2026" in New Delhi, India. At the summit, Altman formally called for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body to address the growing technological risks. He made a striking prediction: by 2028, most of the world's intellectual capacity will reside in data centers. Altman emphasized that with superintelligence potentially emerging in the coming years, society needs time to integrate and understand each technological stage. The international community must remain humble about the still-undefined risks and establish collaborative governance frameworks as early as possible. Furthermore, the summit also discussed the pressures AI development will place on water resources and its potential to boost global employment.
fullContent:
# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest global technology news
**Time**: 2026/2/19 20:55

## Situation Overview
Welcome to the Daily News Channel, I'm Joe. It's a pleasure to join you at this pivotal time of change. In the past 24 hours, from regulatory calls at the New Delhi AI Summit to the intense competition between Russia and Ukraine over satellite communication technology, and breakthroughs in quantum computing and biomedicine, the global technological and political landscape is undergoing a profound restructuring. In this episode, we'll provide an in-depth analysis of 20 major events that have impacted global processes in the past 24 hours. We'll take you inside the tech giants' predictions about the risks of advanced artificial intelligence, focus on the rise of emerging giants in the semiconductor supply chain, and track the latest capital movements in commercial aerospace and green energy. In this age of information overload, we remain objective and neutral, filtering out noise to accurately capture the signals of the future. Please see the detailed report below.

## Key Intelligence
### 1. Altman calls for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body in New Delhi, warning of the approaching era of super artificial intelligence.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Outlook India
- **Summary**: According to Outlook India, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman delivered a keynote speech at the "AI Impact Summit 2026" in New Delhi, India. At the summit, Altman formally called for the establishment of a global AI regulatory body to address the growing technological risks. He made a striking prediction: by 2028, most of the world's intellectual capacity will reside in data centers. Altman emphasized that with superintelligence potentially emerging in the coming years, society needs time to integrate and understand each technological stage. The international community must remain humble about the still-undefined risks and establish collaborative governance frameworks as early as possible. Furthermore, the summit also discussed the pressures AI development will place on water resources and its potential to boost global employment.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Outlook India](https://www.outlookindia.com/national/ai-impact-summit-2026-altman-calls-for-global-ai-regulator-says-superintelligence-could-arrive-within-years)

### 2. The global AI industry is undergoing profound consolidation: GitHub is preparing an AI agent, and Mistral is expanding its computing power footprint.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: InfoWorld
- **Summary**: According to a report by InfoWorld, several key developments occurred in the global AI industry on February 18, 2026, marking a shift in industry focus from model competition to toolchain integration. In terms of technological breakthroughs, GitHub announced plans to launch AI agents capable of automatically maintaining codebases, aiming to reshape the ROI of software development. Meanwhile, industry mergers and acquisitions continued to heat up, with French AI giant Mistral AI further strengthening its strategic position in computing infrastructure through the acquisition of computing platform Koyeb. Analysts point out that these developments indicate that AI is rapidly penetrating the underlying productivity of enterprises, driving a fundamental transformation in software development models.
- **References**:
  - [1] [InfoWorld](https://www.infoworld.com/article/4108092/6-ai-breakthroughs-that-will-define-2026.html)

### 3. Security Alert: Over 128 Million VS Code Extension Installations Worldwide Face Vulnerability Risk
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: InfoWorld
- **Summary**: According to the latest vulnerability research report received by this station, the security situation of VS Code, the widely used editor by developers worldwide, is severe. InfoWorld's investigation shows that due to serious flaws in four mainstream VS Code extensions, approximately 128 million installations globally remain exposed to potential attack risks. Researchers point out that as AI programming tools become increasingly prevalent in enterprises, these infrastructure vulnerabilities targeting development environments could become a new channel for attackers to penetrate corporate intranets. Experts advise affected users to check and update relevant plugins as soon as possible to avoid codebase leaks or unauthorized system access.
- **References**:
  - [1] [InfoWorld](https://www.infoworld.com/article/4108092/6-ai-breakthroughs-that-will-define-2026.html)

### 4. Micron Technology's market capitalization soared to $450 billion, earning it the reputation among investors as the "TSMC of the memory industry."
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: The Motley Fool
- **Summary**: According to The Motley Fool, Micron Technology is poised for a strong performance in 2026, driven by the continued surge in demand for memory chips from AI. Its stock price has risen over 40% since the beginning of the year, pushing its market capitalization to $450 billion. Due to Micron's leading position in AI data centers and advanced packaging, some investors consider it a strategic core player in the memory industry. While the memory chip industry is highly cyclical, analysts believe that Micron's current key role in the semiconductor supply chain and its attractive valuation make it a significant beneficiary of the global AI computing power race, gradually narrowing the market perception gap with logic chip giants.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2026/02/18/is-micron-technology-the-next-taiwan-semiconductor/)

### 5. Russian frontline troops face a communications crisis: Starlink access restrictions and Telegram crackdown hit them hard.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: The Japan Times
- **Summary**: According to The Japan Times and related social media reports, Russian troops stationed in Ukraine are currently facing severe communication disruptions due to SpaceX's technical measures to prevent the use of unauthorized satellite terminals in conflict zones. Elon Musk has confirmed that the company has successfully blocked smuggled terminals from accessing the combat zone. Meanwhile, the Kremlin's recent crackdown on the social media platform Telegram has also inadvertently weakened the tactical coordination and drone warfare capabilities of frontline troops. Military analysts point out that this over-reliance on commercial communication tools has significantly reduced Russian command efficiency after the supply disruption, exposing the limitations of the double-edged sword of commercial technology in modern warfare.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Japan Times](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/02/19/world/russia-military-communication-problems/)
  - [2] [VK (Радио Комсомольская правда)](https://vk.com/video-114816593_456248559)

### 6. Blue Origin's Blue Ring Pathfinder orbit is operating stably, marking a new stage in commercial space logistics.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Satcat.com
- **Summary**: According to the latest orbit monitoring data from Satcat.com, Blue Origin's Blue Ring Pathfinder platform is currently operating stably within its designated orbit. As a multi-functional commercial space tug with mobility capabilities, the platform is designed to provide inter-orbit transportation, payload hosting, and data relay services. The latest orbit roots (TLE) confirm that the asset has demonstrated active orbit-changing maneuverability since its launch in 2025. This progress marks a significant breakthrough for commercial space infrastructure in achieving multi-orbit logistics and data connectivity, laying the foundation for future in-orbit services.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Satcat.com](https://www.satcat.com/sats/62720)

### 7. Quantum Algorithms Optimize Satellite Remote Sensing: Polish Team Dedicated to Achieving Image Processing Through Clouds
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: The Quantum Insider
- **Summary**: According to The Quantum Insider, a team of Polish researchers is testing a new approach to processing satellite imagery using quantum algorithms. The core objective of this research is to address the challenge of existing remote sensing technologies efficiently penetrating cloud cover to extract accurate data. Through quantum machine learning, the research team aims to significantly improve the processing accuracy of Earth observation data. Meanwhile, quantum networking company Aliro announced the completion of a $15 million oversubscribed funding round. These two advancements indicate that quantum technology is rapidly moving from theoretical exploration to commercial satellite applications, particularly in key strategic areas such as secure communications and high-precision remote sensing.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Quantum Insider](https://thequantuminsider.com/2026/02/19/clemson-invests-in-quantum-to-strengthen-states-tech-future/)

### 8. Bimergen Energy plans to list on the NYSE to accelerate the expansion of its grid-scale battery storage farms.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: GlobeNewswire
- **Summary**: According to GlobeNewswire, Bimergen Energy Corporation, specializing in grid-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS), announced plans to list its shares on the NYSE American. The company also intends to raise funds for the expansion of its "battery farms." This move aims to accelerate the deployment of large-scale energy storage infrastructure to support the stability of the power system. With the increasing proportion of renewable energy, Bimergen is committed to transforming into a major independent power generator through next-generation energy storage solutions, reflecting the capital market's continued optimism about new energy infrastructure.
- **References**:
  - [1] [GlobeNewswire](https://www.globenewswire.com/en/Newsroom/GoogleSitemap)

### 9. Ideanomics invests $13 million to support Energica, an Italian high-performance electric motorcycle brand.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Express Press Release
- **Summary**: According to Express Press Release, Ideanomics recently invested $13 million in Energica, an Italian manufacturer of high-performance electric motorcycles. This investment will be specifically used to advance the development of patented electric powertrains and to develop next-generation battery technologies for the electric vehicle industry. As a significant step in sustainable transportation, this investment highlights the industry's continued commitment to improving battery energy density and charging efficiency, and also reflects the deepening electrification trend from the passenger car market to the professional sport motorcycle sector.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Express Press Release](https://express-press-release.net/news/2026/02/19/1738142)

### 10. The University of Michigan released updates on its RNA Medicine Symposium, focusing on translational research in genome editing.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: University of Michigan
- **Summary**: According to an official announcement from the University of Michigan, its RNA Biomedical Center recently released an update on preparations for the 10th Annual RNA Symposium. Scheduled for March 2026, the symposium will focus on the theme "From Mechanisms to Medicine." The conference will bring together leading experts from around the world to discuss how cutting-edge fields such as genome editing, epigenetics, and RNA structure are driving biomedical discoveries and translating them into practical medical applications. In addition, the symposium will concurrently host "Latine Research Week," showcasing the central role of multidisciplinary research in understanding complex disease mechanisms and highlighting the pivotal role of RNA technology in future precision medicine.
- **References**:
  - [1] [University of Michigan (Center for RNA Biomedicine)](https://events.umich.edu/list/csv?filter=tags:Michigan%20Engineering&range=2026-02-14)

### 11. Capital activity in the quantum industry: Quantumation raises €220 million, Pasqal races towards unicorn status.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Quantum Zeitgeist
- **Summary**: According to Quantum Zeitgeist and Bloomberg, the quantum technology capital market performed strongly in February 2026. Quantonation Ventures announced the completion of €220 million in funding for its second flagship fund, becoming the world's largest dedicated quantum technology investment fund. Meanwhile, Pasqal, a leading European quantum computing company, is also seeking a massive €200 million in funding, aiming to achieve "unicorn" status with a valuation exceeding $1 billion. These large-scale funding moves clearly signal that despite a complex macroeconomic environment, global capital's confidence in quantum hardware and its long-term commercialization potential remains solid.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Quantum Zeitgeist](https://quantumzeitgeist.com/quantonation-quantum-investment-fund/)
  - [2] [Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/feeds/sitemap_news.xml)

### 12. New global advances in quantum research: Northeastern University achieves room temperature manipulation, and the academic community deepens research on post-quantum cryptography.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: The Quantum Insider
- **Summary**: According to The Quantum Insider, the academic community has recently made several breakthroughs in quantum infrastructure and security. Clemson University announced a significant investment to strengthen quantum technology research, accelerating the transition of research results from the laboratory to applications; a research group at Northeastern University successfully achieved quantum metric manipulation at room temperature, laying the physical foundation for the development of practical quantum devices. Furthermore, BTQ Technologies and Macquarie University have entered into a strategic partnership to jointly advance the development of quantum security and post-quantum cryptography (PQC) standards to address the challenges that future quantum computing will pose to existing encryption systems.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Quantum Insider](https://thequantuminsider.com/2026/02/19/clemson-invests-in-quantum-to-strengthen-states-tech-future/)

### 13. Nvidia deepens its AI cooperation with India; Indian government allocates trillions of rupees to build industry ecosystem.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to Deccan Herald, at the 2026 India AI Impact Summit, NVIDIA executives emphasized the urgency of expanding AI investment in India. The Indian government has officially allocated 1,037.192 billion rupees for the "India AI Mission," aiming to build a population-scale AI ecosystem covering both manufacturing and service sectors. It is understood that partners such as AAOI have decided to adopt NVIDIA's latest Blackwell and Rubin architectures to build computing infrastructure. Meanwhile, tax incentives in India's new fiscal year budget are attracting global data center service providers to the region, helping India gain a more competitive position in the global AI landscape.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)
  - [2] [GlobeNewswire](https://www.globenewswire.com/en/Newsroom/GoogleSitemap)

### 14. Upgrading digital connectivity between the US, India, and Europe: Submarine cable projects and 6G R&D collaborations proceed in tandem.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to our observations, India is significantly strengthening its digital infrastructure through strategic cooperation. Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced the launch of the "US-India Connectivity Initiative," which aims to enhance connectivity between the two continents by laying new undersea cables. Meanwhile, in a meeting with the European Union, both sides reaffirmed that 6G technology, artificial intelligence, and clean energy partnerships would be central to their economic cooperation by 2026. India and the EU are committed to doubling trade through technological cooperation and establishing deeper ties in defense innovation to jointly address the global governance challenges brought about by digital transformation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)

### 15. MWC 2026 Preview: Network Automation and Edge Intelligence at the Core, Data Center Expansion Accelerating
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: GlobeNewswire
- **Summary**: According to the latest news from GlobeNewswire, preparations for the 2026 Mobile World Congress (MWC 2026) have entered a crucial stage. This year's exhibition will focus on network automation, bare-metal networks, and edge intelligence. In the infrastructure sector, Defi Development Corp plans to acquire a 55-megawatt power generation facility and large data center base in Texas, demonstrating the accelerated shift of computing resources to energy-rich regions. Meanwhile, the application of the open-source network software VyOS in hybrid clouds has received widespread attention in the industry, indicating that future network architectures will evolve towards more flexible and intelligent edge computing.
- **References**:
  - [1] [GlobeNewswire](https://www.globenewswire.com/en/Newsroom/GoogleSitemap)

### 16. The EU has released a digital network legislation proposal, and the AI Office plans to launch content transparency guidelines in the second quarter.
- **Time**: 2026-01-21
- **Source**: European Union
- **Summary**: According to a report from our Brussels correspondent, the European Commission recently officially released its proposal for the Digital Networks Act (DNA). The core of this act is to simplify existing digital connectivity rules, aiming to remove obstacles to building a more efficient and unified communications infrastructure across the EU. The European Commission stated that this is an important step in the EU's digital transformation strategy. Meanwhile, the EU's AI office has also made new progress, working intensively on guidelines for the labeling and transparency of generative AI content. These guidelines are expected to be officially released in the second quarter of 2026, at which time all AI developers operating in Europe will be required to comply with the relevant transparency requirements. Observers believe this marks a shift in the EU's AI regulation from the legislative stage to the implementation stage, with a focus on ensuring the authenticity and traceability of AI-generated content.
- **References**:
  - [1] [European Union](https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/regulatory-framework-ai)

### 17. Texas's Responsible AI Governance Act enters its first monitoring week, with the regulatory sandbox mechanism attracting significant attention.
- **Time**: 2026-01-18
- **Source**: Champaign Magazine
- **Summary**: According to a recent report by Champaign Magazine, Texas's Responsible AI Governance Act (TRAIGA) officially took effect on January 1, 2026. This week marked the first compliance monitoring week for the act, with the entire US tech community closely watching its developments. As the first major state-level comprehensive AI law in the US, TRAIGA innovatively introduces a "regulatory sandbox" mechanism. This mechanism allows startups and tech giants to test their AI models in real-world environments with a degree of transparency, without the immediate fear of hefty fines. Texas officials stated that this approach aims to balance technological innovation with risk control, ensuring that AI development complies with ethical standards. Currently, Texas has established a dedicated agency to collect compliance data for the first week, marking a milestone not only for Texas's AI governance but also providing a legal model for other states in the US.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Champaign Magazine](https://champaignmagazine.com/2026/01/18/ai-by-ai-weekly-top-5-january-12-18-2026/?trk=article-ssr-frontend-pulse_little-text-block)

### 18. Silicon Valley AI giants clash: OpenAI launches ultra-fast programming model, Google Gemini deepens its research efforts.
- **Time**: 2026-02-12
- **Source**: Simon Willison's Weblog
- **Summary**: According to industry news posted by renowned tech blogger Simon Willison, OpenAI and Google unveiled their flagship models within the past 24 hours. OpenAI announced a deep collaboration with computing giant Cerebras to launch a new model called GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark, which focuses on real-time programming and can assist developers in writing and refactoring complex code at astonishing speed. Almost simultaneously, Google launched the Gemini 3 Deep Think model, which goes beyond everyday conversations and is designed to tackle extreme challenges in scientific research. Google stated that Gemini 3 Deep Think will be primarily applied to fields requiring deep logical reasoning, such as biomedical and physical simulations. These flurry of activity from both companies indicate that the AI competition in 2026 has shifted from general-purpose domains to high-performance, specialized niche tracks, with developers and scientists emerging as the biggest beneficiaries.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Simon Willison's Weblog](https://simonw.substack.com/p/two-new-showboat-tools-chartroom)

### 19. 2026 marks the beginning of the "enforcement year" for global AI regulation, with cross-border accountability and content tagging becoming industry consensus.
- **Time**: 2026-01-21
- **Source**: Global AI Regulation Overview
- **Summary**: According to a comprehensive review jointly released by Credo AI, Securiti.ai, and other organizations, 2026 has been widely recognized as the "Year of Implementation" for global AI regulation. The report points out that current regulatory trends are exhibiting unprecedented stringency, with a core characteristic being the mandatory labeling of generative AI content to prevent the proliferation of misinformation. Furthermore, transnational accountability is being strengthened, making it impossible for companies to evade regulation through cross-border operations. Represented by California's AB 2013 and the EU's AI Act, major jurisdictions are mandating that developers disclose the sources of data used to train AI models. Experts analyze that this requirement for transparency in training data is not only to protect copyright but also to prevent algorithmic bias and discrimination. This synchronized global action signifies the official end of the era of unchecked growth in the AI industry, with compliance becoming a matter of life and death for technology companies.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Global AI Regulation Overview; Credo AI; Cimplifi; Securiti.ai](https://regulations.ai/regulations/RAI-REG-GLOBAL-SUMMARY-2026)

### 20. Experts predict that by 2026, AI agents will completely replace voice assistants, and multimodal interaction will become the norm.
- **Time**: 2026-01-24
- **Source**: Medium (KASATA)
- **Summary**: A leading forecast report from Medium predicts that 2026 will be a major turning point in the development of generative AI. Industry experts predict that models with deep reasoning capabilities will reach unprecedented maturity, and traditional voice assistants that can only perform simple commands will be replaced by more autonomous "AI agents." These AI agents will not only understand commands but also independently plan and execute complex tasks, such as automatically arranging business trips or performing preliminary financial statement analysis. The report also emphasizes that multimodal interaction is no longer an experimental feature but has become the industry norm, with AI seamlessly understanding and generating video, audio, and image content. This shift from "conversational tools" to "executive agents" signifies a fundamental restructuring of the collaborative relationship between humans and machines, with AI rapidly integrating into every aspect of daily life.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Medium (KASATA)](https://kasata.medium.com/the-2026-generative-ai-revolution-10-mind-blowing-breakthroughs-that-are-reshaping-everything-f6d25ac71e67)
